title: Sidnei (footballer, born 1989)
text:
Sidnei Rechel da Silva Júnior (born 23 August 1989), known simply as Sidnei, is a Brazilian professional <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="centre-back">centre-back</a> for <a href="Cruzeiro%20Esporte%20Clube">Cruzeiro Esporte Clube</a>.
Club career.
Internacional.
Born in <a href="Alegrete">Alegrete</a>, <a href="Rio%20Grande%20do%20Sul">Rio Grande do Sul</a>, Sidnei started playing professionally with <a href="Sport%20Club%20Internacional">Sport Club Internacional</a>, being part of the side that conquered the <a href="2007%20Recopa%20Sudamericana">2007 edition</a> of the <a href="Recopa%20Sudamericana">Recopa Sudamericana</a>. On 24 July 2008 he signed a five-year contract with <a href="S.L.%20Benfica">S.L. Benfica</a>, who paid €5 million for 50% of his sporting rights.
Benfica.
Sidnei was used intermittently during his <a href="2008%E2%80%9309%20Primeira%20Liga">first season</a> in Portugal, but still managed to appear in 24 <a href="Primeira%20Liga">Primeira Liga</a> games and score three goals in as many wins, including the 2–0 <a href="Local%20derby">derby</a> home win against <a href="Sporting%20CP">Sporting CP</a> on 27 September 2008. In November, Benfica bought another 50% of his rights for €2 million, and <a href="GestiFute">GestiFute</a> acquired the rights to receive 30% from any future transfer. He played only five league matches <a href="2009%E2%80%9310%20Primeira%20Liga">the following campaign</a> – ten competitive appearances – as the club won the national championship after a five-year wait.
After spending the first half of <a href="2010%E2%80%9311%20Primeira%20Liga">2010–11</a> on <a href="Substitute%20%28association%20football%29">the bench</a>, Sidnei was propelled to the starting XI after <a href="David%20Luiz">David Luiz</a> moved to <a href="Chelsea%20F.C.">Chelsea</a> in the winter <a href="transfer%20window">transfer window</a>. On 21 February 2011, he was <a href="Ejection%20%28sports%29">sent off</a> in a league game at Sporting but his team still managed to win it 2–0 and, later the following month, he renewed his contract for a further three seasons until 2016; however, due to poor performances, he lost his starting place to <a href="Jardel%20Nivaldo%20Vieira">Jardel</a>.
In early June 2011, <a href="Be%C5%9Fikta%C5%9F%20J.K.">Beşiktaş J.K.</a> agreed with Benfica on a one-year loan, with the option to make the move permanent. On 19 September he scored a brace for the first in his career, helping to a 3–1 <a href="S%C3%BCper%20Lig">Süper Lig</a> home victory over <a href="MKE%20Ankarag%C3%BCc%C3%BC">MKE Ankaragücü</a>.
As the Turkish club opted against exercising its option, Sidnei returned to Portugal and found himself demoted to <a href="S.L.%20Benfica%20B">the B team</a>. On 29 July 2013, he and <a href="Pizzi%20%28Portuguese%20footballer%29">Pizzi</a> were loaned to <a href="La%20Liga">La Liga</a>'s <a href="RCD%20Espanyol">RCD Espanyol</a> on a one-year deal.
Deportivo.
On 1 September 2014, Sidnei moved to fellow league side <a href="Deportivo%20de%20La%20Coru%C3%B1a">Deportivo de La Coruña</a> also on loan. After making 32 appearances to help his team <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20La%20Liga">avoid relegation</a>, his loan was extended for a further year.
Sidnei had a contract running until 2018, with the <a href="Galicia%20%28Spain%29">Galicians</a> sharing his rights with Benfica and GestiFute. He scored his first goal in the <a href="Spanish%20football%20league%20system">Spanish top division</a> on 5 December 2016, helping the hosts rout <a href="Real%20Sociedad">Real Sociedad</a> 5–1.
On 19 July 2018, Deportivo announced they had reached an agreement with <a href="FC%20Krasnodar">FC Krasnodar</a> over the transfer of Sidnei. The deal was called off two days later, however, with the player having been unable to agree terms.
Betis.
In August 2018, Sidnei joined <a href="Real%20Betis">Real Betis</a> also from the Spanish top flight on a four-year contract. On 31 August 2021, after 64 official matches, the 32-year-old terminated his contract with the club.
Honours.
Internacional
Benfica
